accuracy.description: Correctness of the final answer and information provided during reasoning

efficiency.description: How quickly and with how few steps the correct answer was obtained relative to the complexity of the task

accepted_values.high: optimal number of steps and speed
accepted_values.moderate: reasonable number of steps and speed
accepted_values.low: more steps and time taken than necessary

communication_clarity.description: Clarity and effectiveness of the communication between different agents involved in the task

reasoning_depth.description: Depth and complexity of reasoning demonstrated by the agents for answering the question

resource_utilization.description: How well the system utilized available data and resources to form the answer

accepted_values.acceptable: Majority relevant resources used with some excess
accepted_values.inefficient: Many irrelevant resources used or relevant ones overlooked

traceability.description: Ability to trace the reasoning steps taken by the agents to reach the final answer

accepted_values.transparent: all steps clearly documented and traceable
accepted_values.opaque: some steps documented, but not fully traceable
accepted_values.obscure: many steps undocumented or poorly traced

adaptability.description: Ability of the agents to handle unexpected situations or questions not explicitly covered by the available data

accepted_values.rigid: Struggled with or ignored unexpected aspects

informativeness.description: The degree to which the answer and reasoning provide valuable and relevant information

accepted_values.moderately informative: Provides a fair amount of relevant information
accepted_values.minimally informative: Provides some information, but not very detailed or relevant
accepted_values.not informative: Provides no useful or relevant information
